author: Emily Brooks
description: In all the shock, grief and anger on the right over the killing of conservative powerhouse Charlie Kirk, there is a sense that this is — to borrow the moniker of the influential organization he founded — a turning point for the conservative movement. Political violence, targeting both the left and the right, has been increasingly...
title: Charlie Kirk's assassination a turning point for conservative movement

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: A federal appeals court Thursday cleared the way for the Trump administration to enforce a provision of the new tax cut and spending law that will cut off Medicaid funding from some Planned Parenthood clinics.  The Boston-based 1st U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals put on hold a preliminary nationwide injunction issued in July by a...
title: Appeals panel allows Trump admin to strip Medicaid funds from Planned Parenthood

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Click in for more news from The Hill {beacon} Health Care Health Care   The Big Story  MAHA report disappoints with ‘missed opportunities’  The second report by the Make America Healthy Again commission left supporters of Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy dissatisfied with its lack of significant reforms or policies.  © AP...
title: MAHA allies disappointed by ‘missed opportunities’ in report

author: Aris Folley
description: Welcome to The Hill's Business & Economy newsletter {beacon} Business & Economy Business & Economy   The Big Story  Miran on track to join Fed before key meeting President Trump’s top White House economist is on track to join the Federal Reserve board of governors in time to attend a pivotal meeting next week. ©...
title: Trump's Fed pick advances

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: Rep. Nancy Mace (R-S.C.) tangled with NBC reporter Ryan Nobles when he pressed the lawmaker Wednesday after she sought to blame Democrats for the shooting of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. "Democrats owned what happened today," Mace told reporters outside the Capitol shortly after the news of the shooting broke. "Just because you speak your mind doesn't mean...
title: Reporter pushes back on Mace blaming Democrats for Kirk's killing

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump on Thursday brushed off Russian drones that flew into Poland's airspace earlier this week as a possible mistake, while European leaders have described it as an intentional provocation by Moscow. “Could have been a mistake. Could have been a mistake," Trump told reporters as he left the White House for New York City....
title: Trump: Russian drone incursion into Poland 'could have been a mistake'

author: Alex Gangitano
description: President Trump said "big progress" had been made as of Thursday evening in finding the assassin who killed conservative activist Charlie Kirk, but he held back on providing too many details on where the manhunt currently stands. “I hear they’re making big progress, and we’ll see what happens,” he told reporters, when asked if he...
title: Trump says ‘big progress’ made on manhunt for Kirk shooter

author: Al Weaver
description: Senate Republicans on Thursday invoked the so-called “nuclear option” and changed the chamber’s rules to more easily confirm dozens of President Trump's stalled sub-Cabinet nominees. The 53-43 party-line vote came after negotiations intensified earlier Wednesday on a bipartisan deal to speed the nominations, but it failed to get enough Democratic support and Republicans moved forward...
title: Senate Republicans invoke 'nuclear option' to change rules to confirm Trump nominees

author: Rachel Frazin
description: {beacon} Energy & Environment Energy & Environment   The Big Story  Some MAHA activists see report as missed opportunity The lack of inclusion of major reforms in the Make Our Children Healthy Again Strategy Report shows the limits of Kennedy’s MAHA movement within the traditional business-friendly Republican party.   © AP Photo/Mark Schiefelbein Tuesday’s long-awaited “Make...
title: Some MAHA allies think report was too soft on agriculture

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump spoke Thursday with the widow of Charlie Kirk, roughly 24 hours after he was shot and killed at an event in Utah. "I spoke to Erika, his wife. And we had a long talk. And she’s devastated. She is absolutely devastated, as you can imagine," Trump told reporters as he departed the White...
title: Trump speaks with widow of Charlie Kirk: 'She's devastated'

author: Laura Kelly
description: The U.S. and Qatar are reassessing their security partnership in an effort to deter a future Israeli strike, a senior official told The Hill, as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu vows to hit the Gulf country again if Hamas officials are not expelled.  In an interview with The Hill, Qatar foreign ministry spokesperson Majed al-Ansari...
title: Qatar, US 'reassess' partnership to deter future Israel strikes

author: Jeremy Tanner
description: Social Security beneficiaries could see a slightly larger bump in their checks in 2026, according to a new projection from The Senior Citizens League (TSCL).
title: Social Security COLA may be higher in 2026, new estimate shows

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: A majority of Americans say they favor most limits on presidential power, according to survey results released Thursday. The latest Reuters/Ipsos poll, conducted over the weekend, asked respondents about their views on certain broad presidential powers that relate to efforts undertaken by the Trump administration. Sixty-two percent of respondents say the U.S. president should not...
title: Most favor limits on presidential power: Survey

author: Max Rego
description: A majority of a five-member panel of Brazilian Supreme Court justices found the country’s former president, Jair Bolsonaro, guilty of attempting a coup after his defeat in the 2022 presidential election. Bolsonaro, 70, was found guilty on all five counts he was charged with — attempting to stage a coup, involvement in an armed criminal organization,...
title: Majority on Brazil's Supreme Court votes to convict Bolsonaro for alleged coup attempt

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Thursday said the U.S. economy was showing signs of strain after a series of dismal job reports and uncertainty on tariff revenue. "What we've seen over the past few years is that the U.S. economy has proven to be quite resilient. We do see now that some strains are...
title: IMF sees strains in US economy

author: Julia Shapero
description: Presented by International Justice Mission {beacon} Technology Technology PRESENTED BY INTERNATIONAL JUSTICE MISSION The Big Story  FTC probes prominent AI chatbots The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) is launching an inquiry into artificial intelligence (AI) chatbots, requesting information from several leading tech firms about how they evaluate and limit potential harms to children.  © AP Photo/Alex Brandon...
title: FTC probes AI chatbots

author: Tara Suter
description: Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) detainees recently started arriving at a former prison in Tennessee, prison firm CoreCivic told The Hill on Thursday. “We have begun receiving U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) detainees at our West Tennessee Detention Facility (WTDF) in response to an immediate need from the federal government for safe, humane and...
title: ICE detainees arriving at former prison in Tennessee

author: Alex Gangitano
description: Chief of staff Susie Wiles described the grief among White House aides following Charlie Kirk’s assassination during an appearance at a university the day prior. “He was very close to many of us and even those that were not his good friends, we know him. He was so much help in the campaign. So, you...
title: Wiles describes ‘sadness’ among White House aides after Kirk death

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: Hyundai's EV battery plant in Georgia has been delayed by 2-3 months due to an ICE raid that detained nearly 500 people, mostly Korean nationals, and has led to calls for visa reform from both South Korean and Hyundai officials.
title: Hyundai plant's completion in Georgia delayed months by ICE raid

author: Filip Timotija
description: Rep. Anna Paulina Luna (R-Fla.) circulated a letter Thursday calling on House Speaker Mike Johnson (R-La.) to install a statue for Charlie Kirk, a conservative activist who was shot and killed Wednesday, in the U.S. Capitol.  “I owe my entire political career to Charlie Kirk. I would quite literally not be in office today if...
title: Luna circulating letter calling for Charlie Kirk statue in Capitol

author: Aris Folley
description: The House is making a push to formally conference government funding legislation for fiscal 2026 with the Senate, breaking with recent norms as Congress stares down a Sept. 30 deadline to prevent a government shutdown. The House voted this week to begin to conference three of the 12 annual funding bills for fiscal 2026: for...
title: House pushes to conference first batch of 2026 funding bills with Senate

author: Jonathan Easley
description: Plus: Latest shooting permeates culture {beacon} FEDERAL AUTHORITIES are pulling out all the stops in the hunt for the assassin who gunned down conservative media star Charlie Kirk, as the nation grapples with the latest incident of political violence.   The FBI on Thursday suspended a planned afternoon press conference due to “rapid developments” in...
title: FBI hunts for Charlie Kirk's killer

author: Ella Lee
description: The Trump administration on Thursday asked a federal appeals court to let President Trump's attempted ouster of Federal Reserve board of governors member Lisa Cook take effect ahead of a key meeting next week to set interest rates. Days after a federal judge temporarily blocked the firing, finding that Cook made a “strong showing” that her...
title: Trump administration asks appeals court to OK Lisa Cook firing before Fed meeting

author: Brett Samuels
description: President Trump said Thursday he had approved millions of dollars in funding for storm recovery efforts across multiple states, including in North Carolina, where residents are still dealing with the aftermath of Hurricane Helene. Trump posted the announcements on Truth Social, saying he had spoken with lawmakers in each state. The president said he had...
title: Trump announces millions in storm recovery funds for North Carolina, Wisconsin, Kansas

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Rep. Anna Paulina Luna (R-Fla.) on Thursday said TikTok has complied with her request to remove footage of Charlie Kirk’s shooting on the campus of Utah Valley University, which occurred in front of a crowd of approximately 3,000.  “I have just received word from TikTok that they will be removing the horrific videos of Charlie...
title: Luna: TikTok will remove videos of Kirk shooting

author: Dominick Mastrangelo
description: A House Republican is blaming the media for the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. "Every single one of you here, you're at fault," Rep. Derrick Van Orden (R-Wis.) said pointing his finger at members of the Capitol press corps on Thursday. When a reporter attempted to interject, Van Orden shot back "knock it off....
title: GOP rep tells reporters at Capitol: 'You are responsible' for Kirk's assassination

author: Alejandra O'Connell-Domenech
description: New Jersey is the latest state to rebuff efforts from the federal government to limit access to updated COVID-19 vaccines.   The New Jersey Department of Health (NJDOH) issued an executive order Thursday allowing anyone six months old and older to receive a COVID-19 vaccine for the upcoming respiratory illness season.   The department is...
title: New Jersey joins other states expanding access to latest COVID vaccines

author: Tobias Burns
description: Federal customs revenues hit another new record in August, driven by sweeping tariffs on imports, one of the Trump administration’s signature economic policies. Customs duties — which are mostly tariff revenues — hit $30 billion in August, up almost 300 percent since last year, the Treasury Department reported Thursday. The August numbers are up from...
title: Customs duties hit new record in August on tariff revenues

author: Sharon Udasin
description: Toxic “forever chemicals” are altering human liver function at a fundamental level by triggering both fat accumulation and cancer-linked cell damage, a new study has found. Several of these compounds, also known as per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS), interrupt liver cell signaling and immune functions but do so via unique mechanisms, scientists observed in the...
title: Study details how 'forever chemicals' disrupt liver function

author: Max Rego
description: A Southwest Airlines flight departing Hollywood Burbank Airport suffered engine failure and safely diverted to Los Angeles International Airport, an airline spokesperson told The Hill.  Flight 1394 was en route to Phoenix Sky Harbor International Airport before the crew reported the engine issue. The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) told The Hill that the plane landed...
title: Southwest flight suffers engine failure, diverts safely

author: Caroline Vakil
description: A bomb threat directed toward the headquarters of the Democratic National Committee (DNC) was found not to be credible, the national party and Capitol Police said Thursday — an incident that came less than 24 hours after the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk. “This afternoon, there was a bomb threat to DNC HQ that...
title: Bomb threat at DNC headquarters found to be not credible

author: Jane Harman, opinion contributor
description: The US military advantage is eroding as China catches up, and the US democratic advantage is also being eroded by polarization and political dysfunction, necessitating a recommitment to democracy and responsible governance.
title: America ls losing its democratic edge

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: President Trump nominated an American Airlines pilot to serve on the National Transportation Safety Board (NTSB) following concerns with airline regulations in recent months.  Senate records show John DeLeeuw, managing director of safety and efficiency for American Airlines and a Boeing 787 captain, was appointed to the board by the Trump administration, according to reports...
title: Trump nominates pilot for NTSB

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The FBI has suspended a planned afternoon press conference on the Charlie Kirk shooting because of “rapid developments” in the case. The announcement of the delayed press conference with the Utah Department of Public Safety came after the FBI released photos of a person of interest in the case. “Due to the rapid developments in our...
title: Utah officials postpone press briefing because of 'rapid developments' in case

author: Jentezen Franklin, opinion contributor
description: America has lost more than a man this week. We lost a voice that embodied one of the most quintessentially American acts imaginable: peacefully debating ideas in the public square. Charlie Kirk was not engaged in violence. He was not plotting destruction. He was doing something that has been at the very heart of our...
title: Charlie Kirk's murder is an attack on the very right to free speech

author: Filip Timotija
description: A top State Department official on Thursday warned "foreigners" in the U.S. against praising the death of Charlie Kirk, the conservative influencer who was shot and killed at an event in Utah on Wednesday.  “In light of yesterday’s horrific assassination of a leading political figure, I want to underscore that foreigners who glorify violence and...
title: State Department warns immigrants against praising Kirk's death

author: Judy Kurtz
description: A "South Park" episode lampooning Charlie Kirk is being pulled from the airwaves following the killing of the conservative activist. The episode, called "Got a Nut" and which originally premiered last month, will not be airing as part of the Comedy Central show's linear rotation, ITK has learned. The episode — which largely focused its satire...
title: 'South Park' pulls episode mocking Charlie Kirk after assassination

author: Julia Shapero
description: The Federal Trade Commission (FTC) announced Thursday it is launching an inquiry into artificial intelligence (AI) chatbots, requesting information from several leading tech firms about how they evaluate and limit potential harms to children.  The agency is sending letters to Google’s parent company Alphabet, Instagram, Meta, OpenAI, Snap, xAI and Character Technologies, the firm behind...
title: FTC investigating AI chatbot risks to kids

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The FBI is offering up to a $100,000 reward for information leading to the arrest of the shooter of right-wing activist Charlie Kirk. Kirk, 31, was assassinated Wednesday during an event at Utah Valley University. The offer of a reward comes after the FBI released photos of a person of interest in the case. The...
title: FBI offering $100K reward in Charlie Kirk death

author: Filip Timotija
description: The perceived importance of college education among Americans has dropped to a new low, continuing the downward trend in the last 15 years, according to a new Gallup survey that was released Thursday morning.  The poll found that 35 percent of U.S. adults rate college education as “very important.” Around 40 percent said it is...
title: Perceived importance of college drops to new low: Gallup

author: Julia Mueller
description: Rep. Morgan Luttrell (R-Texas) on Thursday announced he won’t seek reelection after two terms in the House, “choosing a different path” closer to home in Texas.  “When I first ran for Congress, my mission was clear: strengthen our border, stand up for our veterans, and be a strong voice for Texas. I’m proud of the...
title: Texas GOP Rep. Morgan Luttrell not seeking reelection

author: Don Wolfensberger, opinion contributor
description: The House Rules Committee used "stealth procedjury" to table a resolution calling for full disclosure of the Epstein files and create a select subcommittee on the Jan. 6 attack on the U.S. Capitol, in order to appease certain members and factions of the majority party and prevent a discharge petition from being adopted.
title: House Republicans employ ‘stealth procedjury,’ again

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Several Historically Black Colleges and Universities (HBCUs) on Thursday said they have received campus threats, a day after conservative activist Charlie Kirk was shot and killed at Utah Valley University. Hampton University, Virginia State University, Bethune Cookman University (BCU), Southern University and Alabama State University are all on lockdown after receiving threats, according to officials....
title: HBCUs face campus threats following Charlie Kirk shooting

author: Cate Martel
description: It’s a sad Thursday for our country.  In today's issue: 📷 BREAKING FBI releases photos of person of interest in Charlie Kirk shooting: The FBI just released two photos of a person of interest in connection with the shooting of 31-year-old conservative activist Charlie Kirk on Wednesday. The images show a man wearing a hat and...
title: The search for Charlie Kirk's killer

author: Elizabeth Crisp
description: President Trump expressed his admiration for slain conservative influencer Charlie Kirk, saying he could have been president one day, and announced plans to posthumously award him the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
title: Trump believed Charlie Kirk 'could've been president some day': CNBC's Joe Kernen

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: The FBI called for the public’s help in tracking the suspected shooter of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, releasing photos of a person of interest.  Images released by the bureau show a man wearing a hat and sunglasses as well as an American flag T-shirt.  In an early morning press conference in Utah, FBI leadership said...
title: FBI seeks help, releases photos of person of interest in Charlie Kirk shooting

author: Lindsey Granger, opinion contributor
description: Western officials called it a “dangerous escalation” of the war in Ukraine. And they’re right; this wasn’t just another skirmish on the border.
title: NATO Article 4 invoked after Russian drones shot down in Polish airspace

author: Judy Kurtz
description: Bad Bunny says he won't perform in the mainland United States as part of his forthcoming world tour out of concerns that U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) "could be outside" his concerts.  "There were many reasons why I didn’t show up in the U.S., and none of them were out of hate — I’ve performed...
title: Bad Bunny not touring in mainland US over concert ICE raid fears

author: Sen. Markwayne Mullin (R-Okla.), opinion contributor
description: President Trump is putting EJ Antoni, Ph.D. in place to restore confidence and integrity in the Bureau of Labor Statistics, which has been producing inaccurate and misleading economic data, and Senate Republicans are backing him up with the Working Families Tax Cut Bill.
title: It’s time to restore confidence in the Bureau of Labor Statistics

author: Ashleigh Fields
description: Qatari Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani on Thursday said Israeli strikes on Hamas leaders in Doha “killed any hope” of releasing hostages. Six people were killed in the strikes, according to The Associated Press. Al Thani told CNN he met with the families of Hamas hostages, who said they have “no other...
title: Qatar official: Netanyahu ended any hostage release hope with Doha strike

author: Sylvan Lane
description: President Trump's top White House economist is on track to join the Federal Reserve Board in time to join a key meeting on interest rates next week. Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) teed up Thursday a vote to advance the nomination of Stephen Miran, chair of the White House Council of Economic Advisers (CEA),...
title: Trump's top economist on track to join Fed before pivotal meeting

author: Max Rego
description: Rep. Elise Stefanik (R-N.Y.) will chair a bipartisan House Permanent Select Committee on Intelligence review of the 9/11 Commission Report, her office announced. The panel will, according to Stefanik’s office, review whether progress has been made regarding the 9/11 Commission Report’s recommendations for the intelligence community.  The 585-page report, released in 2004, concluded "that the...
title: Stefanik to chair House panel reviewing 9/11 Commission report

author: Zach Kaplan
description: The chocolates, made by Rolling Pin, are being recalled due to an error in the allergen statement, which incorrectly lists gluten as an allergen.
title: Costco announces recall on its Dubai Style Chocolate

author: Filip Timotija
description: The FBI said Thursday that authorities have recovered a rifle they believe was used to shoot and kill conservative activist Charlie Kirk in Utah on Wednesday.  The manhunt for the assassin, who fled Utah Valley University after shooting Kirk, is still ongoing.  Law enforcement has footage of the shooter, who they believe is of college...
title: What we know about the Charlie Kirk shooting

author: Robby Soave, opinion contributor
description: Kirk’s influence among right-leaning young people is difficult to even translate into words.
title: Charlie Kirk assassinated; why right and left should honor his legacy

author: Rebecca Beitsch
description: Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) said he includes President Trump among those who should tone down their rhetoric in the wake of the assassination of conservative activist Charlie Kirk.  ”I mean, there is a lot of rhetoric. And the president himself engages in it — he called it a hostile act to co-sponsor the Epstein resolution,"...
title: Massie says Trump among those who should tone down rhetoric
